instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.16v 0.07a and stuck un DFU
threads.message:
Clean board, no history available.

Already tried 2 new <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> after checking that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> were all present.

I tried to restore T2 with a Mac running Catalina and again on another one with Big Sur, both return and error about not being able to exit DFU mode.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V

No shorts on all other rails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.16v 0.07a and stuck un DFU
threads.message:
Did you try another cable?
I reied with charger cable, good for data, but  couldn't get into DFU.
Only worked for me, with original Thunderbolt 3 cable bought from Apple store (0.8m - 45€).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.16v 0.07a and stuck un DFU
threads.message: I used the same Belkin USB-C cable that I have used to restore all other Macs so the cable is not the issue I don't think, I get some error saying that it could not transition from DFU....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5.16v 0.07a and stuck un DFU
threads.message:
Transition error I also got with one 01521 board.
However, that board starts normal and restarts itself as soon as progress bar appears.
It stays in recovery menu without restarting.
Probably something wrong with T2 chip...
